summary: Warrenton is referenced as the location of the CIA Record Center. The Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) discussed the release of records pertaining to the JFK assassination located at the Warrenton Records Center during a meeting on November 17, 1997. The ARRB made decisions regarding the release of these CIA records.
significance: Warrenton's significance lies in its role as the location of the CIA Record Center, which holds records relevant to the JFK assassination. The ARRB's discussions and decisions regarding the release of these records highlight Warrenton's importance in the context of declassifying information related to the assassination.
